content.description: Use of a long runner on the 6th bolt and a 2 ft runner for the 10th bolt under the small overhang will keep the rope from dragging, the 10th bolt is a bit right of rest of the bolts easy to miss. Fun route with a couple hard moves in the mid section and the top.
content.protection: 13 Bolts with hooks at the anchors
content.location: Furthest route to the right on face of column.

content.description: Long route, but can be done in one pitch with a 70 meter rope. Use long runners on the 3rd, 5th and 9th bolts to reduce rope drag. The 2nd pitch belay anchors are about 30 feet from the top, under the bulge before the lip. There are 3 bolts on the 2nd pitch, and hooks at the top anchors.  Recommend rapping from top rather than being lowered to reduce dragging rope over lip.     Use the 2nd pitch anchors for 60 meter ropes.  The crux is just past the dihedral, several nice moves on this route.
content.protection: 16 bolts and  hooks at the top set of anchors.
content.location: Second route from the left on the wall

content.description: Make your way up the fourth class scramble for about 20 ft to the start of the climb. There is a bolt with a chain half way up to the start on the side wall. Climb up the dihedral, long runners for 5th and 6th bolt will reduce rope drag.  Midway up the face is the crux. Clip to the rope when being lowered to stay close to the route.
content.protection: 9 Bolts plus Hooks at the anchors
content.location: This route is on the north side of the column, the easiest way to get there is to take the side trail to goblin grotto, go past Road to mordor the trail leads to The Reaper.

content.description: Climb starts with a small overhang bulge, nice hand pockets gets you past the first 3 bolts. The crux is a little more than half way up when the route starts going to the right. Fun route, the hard section is only about four moves then it eases up a little with a couple small crimps to a jug at top. Long runners at the 5th and 7th bolt will reduce rope drag.
content.protection: 12 bolts  with Hooks at the anchors
content.location: Third route from the left on the wall.

content.description: Easy climbing to the small dihedral, then  the crux is part way to the anchors. Long runners for the 3rd and 5th bolt will reduce rope drag.
content.location: Far left route on the wall.

content.description: The first column on the north side from the stairs. There are  four face routes and one route on the north side of the column.
